newsitem.title: USA: Typhoon Isa threatens shipping off Guam - WSC.
newsitem.headline: Typhoon Isa threatens shipping off Guam - WSC.

text.p: Typhoon Isa, currently about 315 miles southeast of Guam in the southwest Pacific, will become a major risk to shipping during the next 24-48 hours as the system strengthens rapidly, independent forecaster Weather Services Corp said on Tuesday.
Isa, with 85 mph winds, is near 10n/148e, moving west at 12 mph. It is expected to have winds of more than 130 mph in about 48 hours.

The typhoon is also a strong risk to the Northern Mariana islands during this period. Guam and vicinity are likely to see very heavy rains and very strong winds during the period, and damage due to winds and flooding is expected, WSC said.
